bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
After creating a disk from Fedora iso using --format --reset-mbr, booting from the disk shows Failed to load ldlinux.c32
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
livecd-tools-23.4-1.fc25.x86_64 syslinux-6.04-0.1.fc25.x86_64 e2fsprogs-1.43.3-1.fc25.x86_64
Additional info:
e2fsprogs-1.43 now creates by default fs with 64bit feature enabled, and this is not supported by syslinux >= 6.03, this is breaking livecd-iso-to-disk. Please see:
http://www.syslinux.org/wiki/index.php?title=Filesystem
Has there been any communication with the syslinux maintainer in Fedora or syslinux upstream about the issue? I would prefer to be able to properly support 64bit ext4 rather than disabling it.

(In reply to Neal Gompa from comment #1) > Has there been any communication with the syslinux maintainer in Fedora or > syslinux upstream about the issue? I would prefer to be able to properly > support 64bit ext4 rather than disabling it.
I really dont know, it only needs to be disabled for /boot I think.

(In reply to Neal Gompa from comment #1) > Has there been any communication with the syslinux maintainer in Fedora or > syslinux upstream about the issue? I would prefer to be able to properly > support 64bit ext4 rather than disabling it.
I think that livecd-iso-to-disk is mostly used to take an iso and copy it onto a usb in order to install, so I dont really think that 64bit is crucial for the installer fs, unless I'm missing something. Other than that, the previous mke2fs versions did not create 64bit fs, so disabling it in the new version would just keep the original behavior. I've created a pull request for the small fix:
https://github.com/rhinstaller/livecd-tools/pull/43
*** Bug 1412108 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I have fixed this in the rawhide version livecd-tools v24.1.
livecd-tools-24.2-1.fc25 appliance-tools-008.0-3.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-7799a1cc7c

appliance-tools-008.0-3.fc25, livecd-tools-24.2-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates.
